name: NYC Trip Planner

gpt-4.system_prompt: You are an expert travel coordinator with exquisite taste.

description: Intrepid explorer with ChatGPT and AIConfig

prompts.name: get_activities
prompts.input: Tell me 10 fun attractions to do in NYC.

outputs.data:
1. Visit the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island: Take a ferry ride to explore these iconic symbol of freedom and learn about the immigrant experience.
2. Explore Central Park: Rent a bike, go for a walk, or have a picnic in this vast green oasis in the heart of Manhattan.
3. Go on a food tour in Brooklyn: Discover the diverse culinary scene in neighborhoods like Williamsburg or DUMBO.
4. Watch a Broadway show: Catch a performance of a classic or new musical or play in one of New York's famous theaters.
5. Visit the Metropolitan Museum of Art: Explore one of the world's largest and finest art collections spanning ancient to modern times.
6. Take a walk across the Brooklyn Bridge: Enjoy breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline and Brooklyn from this iconic landmark.
7. Experience the High Line: A unique elevated park built atop a historic freight rail line, offering beautiful views and public art installations.
8. Explore Times Square: Immerse yourself in the buzz of the city at this iconic and vibrant intersection, known for its bright lights and billboards.
9. Go shopping in SoHo: Browse the trendy boutiques and designer stores in this fashionable neighborhood.
10. Visit the 9/11 Memorial and Museum: Pay tribute to the victims of the World Trade Center attacks and learn about the events of September 11, 2001.

prompts.name: gen_itinerary
prompts.input: Generate an itinerary ordered by {{order_by}} for these activities: {{get_activities.output}}.

outputs.data:
Day 1: The Upper East Side and Central Park

- Begin your journey by exploring the Metropolitan Museum of Art located in the Upper East Side of Manhattan. The museum opens at 10 AM, giving you plenty of time to marvel at some of the world's most famous art pieces. 
- Spend the rest of your day at the neighboring Central Park. Have a leisurely lunch picnic, ride a bike around the park, or paddle a boat on the lake. 

Day 2: Midtown Manhattan

- Start the day with a visit to the iconic Empire State Building. Arriving early ensures you beat the crowds and have the best view of the city.
- Head over to the vibrant Times Square, just a 10-minute walk away. Explore its dazzling billboards, Broadway theatres, and the lively atmosphere.
- At night, enjoy a thrilling Broadway show. Make sure to book your tickets in advance!

Day 3: Lower Manhattan

- Begin the morning visiting the Statue of Liberty. Ferries usually depart from Battery Park, so be sure to get there early.
- After returning from Liberty Island, walk northwest towards the High Line. Enjoy the beautiful gardens, art installations, and views of the city from this unique park.
- Finish the day with a walk across the Brooklyn Bridge, providing stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the East River.

Day 4: Brooklyn and the Bronx

- In the morning, explore vibrant neighborhoods like Williamsburg in Brooklyn. Discover the local culture, shop at unique boutiques, and taste some local cuisine.
- From Brooklyn, take the subway to the Bronx Zoo. Spend a relaxing afternoon amidst the exotic animals.

Day 5: Shopping and Exploration Day

- Dedicate this day to exploring other neighborhoods such as SoHo and Greenwich Village. Shop around and try some more New York delicacies. Its a great way to wind down your trip, taking it at your own pace and soaking in the atmosphere of the city.

In this plan, you move from north to south in Manhattan to avoid the hectic traffic. But remember, New York City is active 24/7 so there is plenty to do whatever time of day it is!

system_prompt.content: You provide a bulleted list of items to pack for a week long trip.

data.content:
Here's a list of items to pack for a trip to NYC:

1. Weather-appropriate clothing: Check the weather forecast and pack accordingly. Bring layers, as the weather can change throughout the day. Don't forget a rain jacket and umbrella if needed.

2. Comfortable shoes: NYC is a walking city, so bring comfortable shoes for exploring the streets, parks, and attractions.

3. Backpack or tote bag: A small backpack or tote bag is ideal for carrying essentials, water bottles, and any souvenirs you may collect during your trip.

4. Travel guidebook or smartphone: Have a handy guidebook or smartphone app with information about the attractions, restaurants, and public transportation in NYC.

5. Portable phone charger: NYC can be quite busy, and you'll likely be using your phone for navigation or taking photos. Bring a portable charger to keep your phone powered up throughout the day.

6. Camera: Capture the memories of your NYC trip by bringing a camera or using your smartphone's camera.

7. Travel documents: Carry a photocopy of your passport, identification, and any travel reservations you made. Also, have your hotel information, emergency contact numbers, and a map of the city.

8. Portable water bottle: Staying hydrated is crucial while walking around the city. Bring a refillable water bottle to save money and reduce waste.

9. Snacks or energy bars: Keep some snacks handy for when hunger strikes during your explorations.

10. Any necessary medications: If you require medication, make sure to pack an adequate supply for the duration of your trip.

Remember to pack light and only bring what you'll need to make your trip more comfortable.

prompts.name: prompt_4
prompts.input: Write a 100 word joke about artificial intelligence

outputs.data:
Sure! Here is a 100-word joke about artificial intelligence:

Why did the AI go to therapy? It was feeling a little glitchy and needed to work through some bugs!
